exercises.name: Barbell Squat
instructions: Place the bar on your upper back (traps), not your neck.
Keep your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed out.
Inhale and descend by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Keep your chest up and back flat throughout the movement.
Drive through your heels to return to the starting position.

exercises.name: Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on the bench with your feet planted firmly on the floor.
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar slowly to your mid-chest while tucking your elbows slightly.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Keep your shoulder blades squeezed together for stability.

exercises.name: Barbell Row
exercises.muscles: Lats, Upper Back, Biceps, Rear Delts
instructions: Hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
Grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Pull the bar toward your lower chest/upper abdomen.
Squeeze your shoulder blades at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar under control back to the starting position.

exercises.name: Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and grip the bar just outside your shoulders.
Start with the bar at shoulder height, elbows slightly in front of the bar.
Press the bar overhead until your arms are locked out.
Avoid excessive arching of the lower back by bracing your core.
Lower the bar back to the starting position under control.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown station and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Pull your shoulder blades down and back, and then pull the bar down toward your upper chest.
Focus on pulling with your elbows rather than your hands.
Pause at the bottom, then slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Maintain a slight lean back but avoid using momentum.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell against your chest with both hands.
Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower your hips back and down as if sitting into a chair.
Keep your elbows inside your knees at the bottom of the squat.
Drive back up to the starting position.

exercises.name: Dumbbell RDL
instructions: Hold a pair of dumbbells in front of your thighs.
Hinge at the hips, pushing them back while keeping a slight bend in your knees.
Lower the weights along your shins until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Keep your back flat and chest out throughout.
Contract your glutes and hamstrings to return to a standing position.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
instructions: Sit at a cable row station with your feet on the pads and knees slightly bent.
Grip the handle and pull it toward your lower abdomen.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the peak of the movement.
Slowly release the weight back to the starting position.
Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rocking your torso.

exercises.name: Glute Bridges
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Drive through your heels to lift your hips toward the ceiling.
Squeeze your glutes hard at the top of the movement.
Lower your hips back to the floor under control.
Keep your core engaged to prevent over-arching your lower back.

exercises.name: Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and the bar over the middle of your feet.
Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar just outside your legs.
Keep your back flat and chest up as you pull the bar up along your shins.
Stand up fully, locking your hips at the top.
Lower the bar back to the floor by hinging at the hips first.
